20101223020143.000|20101223020146.000|CC1|LAGUNA BEACH FLOODED THIS BADLY 
20101223020146.000|20101223020147.000|CC1|WAS ALMOST 14 YEARS AGO, TONIGHT
20101223020147.000|20101223020149.000|CC1|A BIG CHUNK OF PCH AND THE HEART
20101223020149.000|20101223020153.000|CC1|OF DOWNTOWN ARE STILL CLOSED TO 
20101223020153.000|20101223020155.000|CC1|TRAFFIC BECAUSE OF MUD AND      
20101223020155.000|20101223020155.000|CC1|DEBRIS.                         
20101223020155.000|20101223020158.000|CC1|SO IS ALL OF LAGUNA CANYON ROAD.
20101223020158.000|20101223020200.000|CC1|THE BIGGEST IMPACT IS BEING FELT
20101223020200.000|20101223020203.000|CC1|BY RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES.    
20101223020203.000|20101223020205.000|CC1|WHEN BUSINESS OWNERS IN DOWNTOWN
20101223020205.000|20101223020206.000|CC1|LAGUNA BEACH SHOWED UP FOR WORK 
20101223020206.000|20101223020207.000|CC1|THIS MORNING.                   
20101223020207.000|20101223020209.000|CC1|THE FLOODING HAD LONG SINCE     
20101223020209.000|20101223020209.000|CC1|DAMAGED THEIR MERCHANDISE AND   
20101223020209.000|20101223020211.000|CC1|LEFT THE STREETS A MUDDY DUMP.  
20101223020211.000|20101223020215.000|CC1|>> A LOT OF DEBRIS ON BROADWAY, 
20101223020215.000|20101223020219.000|CC1|GARBAGE CANS, TREE STUMPS, IT   
20101223020219.000|20101223020220.000|CC1|WAS INCREDIBLE TO SEE.          
20101223020220.000|20101223020222.000|CC1|THIS WAS THE CULPRIT.           
20101223020222.000|20101223020224.000|CC1|THE LAGUNA CREEK CHANNEL HASN'T 
20101223020224.000|20101223020226.000|CC1|SPEWED LIKE THIS SINCE 1997.    
20101223020226.000|20101223020227.000|CC1|AT THE PEAK OF THE FLOODING

20101223020229.000|20101223020231.000|CC1|LIKE AN ANGRY GEYSER BENT ON    
20101223020231.000|20101223020233.000|CC1|FILLING EVERYTHING IN SITE WITH 
20101223020233.000|20101223020234.000|CC1|FIVE FEET OF WATER.             
20101223020234.000|20101223020237.000|CC1|>> IT WAS MUCH MORE COMING DOWN.
20101223020237.000|20101223020243.000|CC1|HUGE 5, 10 FOOT WAVES.

20101223020248.000|20101223020250.000|CC1|DO TO FIGHT IT.

20101223020413.000|20101223020414.000|CC1|HOUSE YOU COULDN'T GET OUT.

20101223020416.000|20101223020419.000|CC1|THE HOUSE, IT WAS THE RIVER OF  
20101223020419.000|20101223020424.000|CC1|MUD FLOWING OFF THE BURN AREA.  
20101223020424.000|20101223020426.000|CC1|>> I RAN DOWNSTAIRS TO SEE WHAT 
20101223020426.000|20101223020427.000|CC1|WAS HAPPENING.                  
20101223020427.000|20101223020430.000|CC1|BY THE TIME I GOT DOWNSTAIRS, MY
20101223020430.000|20101223020432.000|CC1|WHOLE BACKYARD WAS FLOODED.     
20101223020432.000|20101223020436.000|CC1|I HAD A RIVER IN MY LIVING ROOM.
20101223020436.000|20101223020438.000|CC1|I GOT NOTHING LEFT.

20101223020442.000|20101223020443.000|CC1|HILLSIDE FORCED THE EVACUATIONS 
20101223020443.000|20101223020445.000|CC1|OF MORE THAN A DOZEN HOMES      
20101223020445.000|20101223020446.000|CC1|DURING THE NOON HOUR.           
20101223020446.000|20101223020447.000|CC1|>> I THOUGHT MAYBE THERE WERE

20101223020556.000|20101223020557.000|CC1|THE CREEK IS SO FULL, THAT WATER
20101223020557.000|20101223020600.000|CC1|IS EATING INTO THE CONTAINMENT  
20101223020600.000|20101223020600.000|CC1|WALL.                           
20101223020600.000|20101223020602.000|CC1|THE AREA HAS GOTTEN AT LEAST    
20101223020602.000|20101223020604.000|CC1|FOUR INCHES OF RAIN, THAT'S JUST
20101223020604.000|20101223020605.000|CC1|TODAY.                          
20101223020605.000|20101223020607.000|CC1|GORDON IS LIVE IN SAN JUAN      
20101223020607.000|20101223020609.000|CC1|CAPISTRANO WITH THE LATEST ON   
20101223020609.000|20101223020609.000|CC1|THIS SITUATION.                 
20101223020609.000|20101223020614.000|CC1|CAN THEY FIX IT?                
20101223020614.000|20101223020615.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WORK CREWS ARE     
20101223020615.000|20101223020616.000|CC1|EXPECTED TO BE HERE THROUGH MOST
20101223020616.000|20101223020618.000|CC1|OF THE EVENING PLUGGING THE TWO 
20101223020618.000|20101223020619.000|CC1|GIANT HOLES.                    
20101223020619.000|20101223020620.000|CC1|TAKE A LOOK.                    
20101223020620.000|20101223020621.000|CC1|THIS IS ONE OF THEM.            
20101223020621.000|20101223020625.000|CC1|AS YOU CAN SEE, THE PORTION OF  
20101223020625.000|20101223020626.000|CC1|THE CONCRETE SMASHED TO BITS BY 
20101223020626.000|20101223020628.000|CC1|THE RAGING RAINWATER.           
20101223020628.000|20101223020630.000|CC1|THE HOLE STARTED APPEARING AT   
20101223020630.000|20101223020632.000|CC1|8:00 THIS MORNING AND GREW TO   
20101223020632.000|20101223020634.000|CC1|FIVE TIMES IT'S ORIGINAL SIZE.  
20101223020634.000|20101223020637.000|CC1|ANOTHER SECTION OF CONCRETE GAVE
20101223020637.000|20101223020640.000|CC1|WAY TO THE OPPOSITE LEVEE.      
20101223020640.000|20101223020642.000|CC1|CLOSE TO 400 HOMES ARE NOW      
20101223020642.000|20101223020644.000|CC1|VACANT IN ONE NEIGHBORHOOD RIGHT
20101223020644.000|20101223020644.000|CC1|ABOVE THE BREACH.               
20101223020644.000|20101223020647.000|CC1|THE GOOD NEWS, THE CREEK HAS    
20101223020647.000|20101223020650.000|CC1|SUBSIDED CONSIDERABLY IN THE    
20101223020650.000|20101223020650.000|CC1|LAST FEW HOURS.                 
20101223020650.000|20101223020652.000|CC1|THE LEVEES ARE STILL CONSIDERED 
20101223020652.000|20101223020652.000|CC1|UNSAFE.                         
20101223020652.000|20101223020654.000|CC1|GIANT BOULDERS WILL BE JAMMED   
20101223020654.000|20101223020657.000|CC1|INTO THE BROKEN PORTIONS        
20101223020657.000|20101223020659.000|CC1|TEMPORARILY BEFORE EVACUEES CAN 
20101223020659.000|20101223020700.000|CC1|BE ALLOWED BACK HOME.           
20101223020700.000|20101223020702.000|CC1|A STRENGTHENING PROJECT HAS BEEN
20101223020702.000|20101223020704.000|CC1|UNDERWAY FOR SOME MONTHS NOW.   
20101223020704.000|20101223020708.000|CC1|AS LUCK WOULD HAVE IT, THE      
20101223020708.000|20101223020708.000|CC1|PROJECT HASN'T REACHED THIS     
20101223020708.000|20101223020709.000|CC1|PORTION.                        
20101223020709.000|20101223020711.000|CC1|THE MAYOR IS NOT SURPRISED THIS 
20101223020711.000|20101223020712.000|CC1|HAPPENED, BECAUSE FRANKLY THE   
20101223020712.000|20101223020714.000|CC1|CEMENT WAS POURED INTO THE      
20101223020714.000|20101223020716.000|CC1|LEVEES 40 YEARS AGO.            
20101223020716.000|20101223020719.000|CC1|REPORTING LIVE FROM SAN JUAN    
20101223020719.000|20101223020720.000|CC1|CAPISTRANO, CHANNEL 4 NEWS.     
20101223020720.000|20101223020722.000|CC1|>> THANKS, GORDON.              
20101223020722.000|20101223020724.000|CC1|THE POSSIBILITY OF MUDSLIDES    
20101223020724.000|20101223020726.000|CC1|PROMPTED AUTHORITIES TO ORDER   
20101223020726.000|20101223020729.000|CC1|MANDATORY EVACUATIONS LAST      
20101223020729.000|20101223020730.000|CC1|NIGHT.                          
20101223020730.000|20101223020732.000|CC1|A LOT OF FOLKS STAYED WHERE THEY
20101223020732.000|20101223020732.000|CC1|WERE.                           
20101223020732.000|20101223020734.000|CC1|THE AREA HAS BEEN SOAKED WITH   
20101223020734.000|20101223020736.000|CC1|TEN INCHES OF RAIN SINCE LAST   
20101223020736.000|20101223020736.000|CC1|WEEK.                           
20101223020736.000|20101223020737.000|CC1|HERE'S CHRIS.                   
20101223020737.000|20101223020739.000|CC1|>> BASICALLY, THE PATROL CARS   
20101223020739.000|20101223020741.000|CC1|BEHIND ME ARE THE PEOPLE WHO    
20101223020741.000|20101223020742.000|CC1|STAYED HERE IN THIS PARTICULAR  
20101223020742.000|20101223020742.000|CC1|AREA.                           
20101223020742.000|20101223020744.000|CC1|IF YOU WANTED TO SAY ALL YOU HAD
20101223020744.000|20101223020746.000|CC1|TO DO WAS SIGN A WAIVER,        
20101223020746.000|20101223020747.000|CC1|BASICALLY DECLINING             
20101223020747.000|20101223020748.000|CC1|RESPONSIBILITY.                 
20101223020748.000|20101223020749.000|CC1|AND THEN YOU COULD ACTUALLY     
20101223020749.000|20101223020750.000|CC1|STAY.                           
20101223020750.000|20101223020751.000|CC1|IN OTHER WORDS, LETTING THE     
20101223020751.000|20101223020752.000|CC1|COUNTY OFF THE HOOK.            
20101223020752.000|20101223020754.000|CC1|AS A MATTER OF FACT, RIGHT NOW  
20101223020754.000|20101223020755.000|CC1|BECAUSE THE RAIN HAS STOPPED.

20101223022051.000|20101223022053.000|CC1|YES THERE WERE EVACUATIONS, YES,
20101223022053.000|20101223022054.000|CC1|THERE WERE MINOR ROCK SLIDES    
20101223022054.000|20101223022056.000|CC1|HERE, YES, THERE WAS MINOR      
20101223022056.000|20101223022057.000|CC1|FLOODING, ALL IN ALL, THINGS ARE
20101223022057.000|20101223022100.000|CC1|GOOD, AND WHEN YOU CONSIDER THAT
20101223022100.000|20101223022101.000|CC1|THE STATION FIRE BURNED A LITTLE
20101223022101.000|20101223022104.000|CC1|MORE THAN A YEAR AGO, AND       
20101223022104.000|20101223022106.000|CC1|LITERALLY TORE OUT THOUSANDS OF 
20101223022106.000|20101223022107.000|CC1|ACRES OF VEGETATION, LEAVING

20101223022111.000|20101223022111.000|CC1|WEREN'T WORSE.
